fields.Slack Instruction & Email Commu:
At the beginning: 

Msg 1: 

Groups for the Startup Challenge
- group of 3 or 4 people

Msg 2: 

PIONEERS STARTUP CHALLENGE
Startup Challenge
Welcome to the Startup Challenge, where you and your designated teams will embark on an exciting journey to create a tech startup from scratch.
Objective: The goal of the Startup Challenge is to complete as many tasks necessary to launch a startup. You will earn points for completing various tasks, each contributing to the success of your project. Prioritization and teamwork is key.
Problem space: you will have to choose a problem space to work on. No existing startup allowed! (Not even from previous mini-challenges)
Team Formation: You will be divided into teams of 3 to 4 participants.
Challenge Tasks and Points:
Your team will have a list of challenges, each with a specific number of points associated with it. These challenges are designed to guide you in developing your startup project. Here's the list of challenges and their points:
User Interviews: Conduct a REAL user interview (out of cohort) to gather insights and feedback on your startup idea. (100 points each)
1-Minute Video of Elevator Pitch (40 points): Create a concise and engaging 1-minute video that presents your elevator pitch. With your phone!
Logo (5 points): Create a unique and memorable logo for your startup project.
6-Slide Pitch Presentation (30 points): Craft a compelling 6-slide pitch presentation that effectively communicates your startup idea.
Landing Page (30 points): Design a captivating landing page that showcases your project's value proposition.
Figma Product Design (50 points): Develop a Figma prototype that demonstrates the functionality and user experience of your product.
User Onboarding Flow (50 points): Design an efficient user onboarding process that guides users in using your product effectively.
LinkedIn Page (15 points): Create a professional LinkedIn page for your startup project, highlighting your team's expertise.
Find 10 ways to promote your product for free (30 points)
Email Subscribers (5 points per email)
Build community of 50 people [for B2C only] (200 points each 50 members)
Sign LOI with someone [for B2B only] (150 points each LOI)
Game Rules:
Teams will choose which challenges to undertake based on their points and project strategy.
Each completed challenge will earn your team the specified points.
The team with the most points at the end of the challenge will be declared the winner.
Important Dates:
Challenge Kick-off: 10:20pm
Challenge Deadline: 12:20pm – present your achievements!
Post your results in the slack #cofounderboat channel – Open a thread with your group name and input your documents!
Scoring and Prizes:
Teams will be scored based on the total points earned from completed challenges.
A 100 EUR amazon gift card per team member will be awarded to the winning team.
Good luck to all !
@channel 

FYI:  Freelancers, early-stage solo founders, creators, indie developers, who pay for tools from their own money are NOT considered B2B customers. They are Prosumers. A B2B Customer considered for full LOI points should pay from company expenses (have cashflow) and have at least 1 Full-time employee.

Warning: :warning: We will deduct points for incomplete or poor task completions.

An LOI must have a digital or physical signature. Emails are not accepted!

a user interview should be an actual conversation with a potential user. Submission should be a recap of that conversation with key learnings!

fields.Name: Pre-IC Decision Announcement
fields.Slack Instruction & Email Commu:
Hey Everyone @channel,
It’s Decision Time!!!
This was very hard decision to make as we’ve been working alongside you for a long time and have developed affinities with each team. Also, we can make mistakes – companies we’ve rejected in the past have gone to be great companies!
So….. After careful evaluation and deliberations with Hugo and the Pioneers team, the following startups have been selected for the Investment Committee:
Umamy
Mirmi
JooobAI
AvaHome
FitBot
GovIntel
A reminder of the Selection criteria (in order of importance):
Execution – GTM traction and product progress
Team – background, cohesion, and founder-product fit
Market – size and potential
 What’s next:
Office Hours: For the teams not moving forward, we’re hosting a feedback session starting at 3pm at the Hogwarts Room next to our space. Please text @Niklas - Pioneers Team  to book your slot.
We do realise that some teams are too early in their adventure and need a bit more time (August timing wasn’t great): we are forecasting to host one more IC in about a month – if you show traction, reach out to us. Any team in the sprint phase is eligible.
Post-IC For those not advancing: you may stay at Station F until the end of November, but since you’re not officially in the program anymore, you would need to cover the cost your seat (€259 + VAT/month/per seat). You all may stay at the Pioneers space until Monday without additional cost.
And ofcourse: you are now part of the Pioneers alumni community meaning you will be invited to our events, workshops and will be fasttracked for consideration for future cohorts :muscle:
Now it’s time for the remaining teams to rock it during the IC this Friday, let’s go!!!!


Hugo's follow-on message: 

Hey Everyone,
I just want to take a moment to say how proud you can be of what you’ve accomplished so far. Whether you’re moving forward to the IC or not, this is just one step in a much longer journey.
As far as I know, building a company is a marathon with many ups and downs; today’s decision doesn’t define your future. What matters is the grit, creativity, and persistence you bring to the adventure. Keep pushing, keep learning, and remember that every milestone (even the tough ones) is part of building something truly meaningful.
We’re rooting for all of you!

fields.Name: Selection Day - Information + Format
fields.Slack Instruction & Email Commu:
@channel Hey everyone,
Happy to be back in Station F after my SF trip - glad to tell you that we're building an insane US track for you!
Selection Day Information
Here’s everything you need to know about Selection Day, happening next Wednesday at 4pm:
Selection Day is the first filter of the program. The main goal of this milestone is to:
1. make sure you are in a team
2. make sure you're on the right track
:jigsaw: Selection Criteria:
Team & Idea – You have locked your team & are fixed on your problem space.
Progress made – You have shown progress: clear user feedback, signs of traction or market interest.
Ambition & vision – Here we make sure the size of your ambition aligns with ours :)
MOAT - You understand what your differentiating factor is.
For solofounders who've decided to pursue the lonely path - we will evaluate your progress as well.
The following Friday we shall announce those who have passed the selection. Good luck!
:date: Format:
Each team will pitch in front of the investment committee.
Format: 3 min pitch + 5 min Q&A.
Your pitch should clearly cover: problem, solution, market, traction (or strong signals), team, and roadmap.
Each team will be assigned a slot and will only join the session on their slot.
It is possible to pitch remotely
-> This is the culmination of 8 weeks of work. Be sharp, be bold, and show us why you’re the right team for this problem.

fields.Name: Office Hours - Sprint (Mo-Wed, 15 min per team)
Selection Day - Result Announcement (+ OH + beer same day)
fields.Slack Instruction & Email Commu:
Hello Pioneers, the moment has come. @channel
First off, thank you for your commitment and effort over the past six weeks. You all deserve a lot of credit. Evaluating your progress wasn’t easy. We faced several edge cases, and early-stage investing is, by definition, shaped by subjective judgment.
A note to those not selected:
Don’t let this stop you, keep building. We’re fully aware that we can make mistakes. Also, some of the best founders I backed at Hook had pitched to us multiple times before getting an investment. You remain part of the Pioneers community and and we’ll be keeping an eye on your progress.
To the selected teams:
This is far from a win. You’ve cleared a checkpoint but there’s still a long way to go to be investment-ready for the IC. There were no clear yes and you’ll all need to seriously accelerate execution and focus on validating core assumptions.
Next steps:
:date: Office Hours – Tomorrow, 11:00–13:00
We’ll be available tomorrow to answer questions. Feel free to ask about the decision-making, and share your honest feedback with us to help us improve.
:wave: Outboarding on Tuesday
For those not continuing in the sprint phase, we’ll outboard you on Tuesday. You can always come back for a meeting, and we will send you an invite.
:beers:For tonight
Let’s celebrate the past weeks together over drinks - you’ve earned it!
:speech_balloon: Slack & alumni community:
For those not selected, you remain part of the Pioneers community and we will invite you to events in the next months (stay tuned for a get-together after IC in September with the batch + friends).
Please also stay active with us on Slack, and let us know whenever the community can support you. Thank you again for your dedication and openness throughout this journey so far.
See you all this evening!
Below are the Selection Day results and the list of teams moving forward to the Sprint Phase.

@channel
Hi everyone,
 Just a quick welcome again from my side—excited to be here with all of you!
A few words on how we use the Slack channels:
:loudspeaker: su25-announcements – For important updates from the staff team. Please don’t post here (but feel free to comment if anything is unclear).
:speech_balloon: su25-general – Open to post for everyone: questions related to the program/event/calendar, thoughts, photos, etc.
:raising_hand: su25-introduce-yourself – We'll ask everyone to write a short intro. I’ll start tomorrow - please follow up.
:jigsaw: su25-a-team-is-born – For team updates: formations, pivots, breakups. Every change is progress and is therefore celebrated! More info about the setup soon.
:handshake: ask-for-intros – Need to validate something? Ask for intro help here. Be specific about the type of person you're looking to talk to. Use it to learn—not sell right away (unless they offer).
:question: ask-anything – Literally anything: social plans, lost items, emotional support.
For urgent things, use the WhatsApp group.

Hi everyone,
Just a quick reminder that we’ll meet again at 2:00 PM in the Creativity Room (inside the Share Zone).

create groups of 3 & 4 people and list them here!!
---

Slack message 2 (after Maxime finishes speaking)

Exercise: The Worst Startup Idea
Goal:
 Come up with the most ridiculously bad startup idea you can think of — and pitch it like it’s the next unicorn.
How It Works
Your Mission
As a team, create and pitch the worst startup idea possible — one that is:
Incredibly niche or solves a non-problem (e.g. throw AI at everything - solution in search of a problem)
Technically or ethically flawed
Completely unscalable
Prep Time
Use this time to brainstorm and prepare a 3-4 minute pitch . Think of:
Name & tagline
Problem Slide
Solution Slide
Business Model
Target Market with Market Size
GTM Strategy / Timeline
Optional: Fundraising
Team
Pitch Time (3-4 min per group)
Each group pitches their horrible idea with full confidence — as if they truly believe in it
Voting
After all pitches, everyone votes for:
Worst Startup Idea
Most Convincing Pitch for a Bad Idea
Best Team Name

fields.Name: Office Hours - Sprint (Mo-Wed, 15 min per team)
Announcing Weekly Theme: Distribution
fields.Slack Instruction & Email Commu:
@channel
Hello Batch – hope your week is off to a strong start.
Reminder: this week’s theme is Distribution.
AI made building easy, now the hard part is reach.
If you can’t get your product in front of the right people, it doesn’t matter how good it is.
So either:
Your product solves such a deep pain that cold outreach converts unusually well,
or
You’ll need to think way outside the box to crack your distribution.
Keep testing. Keep shipping. And remember: the best product doesn’t win, the best distribution does.

2:30–2:55 PM — AWS Perspective with Connor

Friday, June 11

3:00–4:00 PM: AWS Room (Share Zone) – AWS engineer presentation + Q&A

fields.Name: Announcing Weekly Theme: Pivoting
fields.Slack Instruction & Email Commu:
Hey @channel,
This Week’s Theme is: Pivoting
Either your idea got validated, meaning real people were willing to try or even pay for it, or… it didn’t.
If you got traction:
Double down. Take your learnings and optimize your positioning:
Sharpen who your ideal customer is
Refine your messaging and value proposition
Improve onboarding or UX for better conversion
Push toward more proof (repeat usage, new users, or actual payments)
If you didn’t get traction:
That’s totally fine, most don’t. You now need to pivot, and the faster, the better.
Your options:
Hard Pivot (changing the core of the business):
New customer segment
New core problem
New solution or product
Entirely new market
Soft Pivot (same direction, but refined):
Reframing the value prop, narrowing or expanding the user persona
Reworking the channel or go-to-market
Changing the feature focus
Whatever path you’re on, this week is about building clarity and making bold, informed moves.
You’re expected NOT to get things right. You are expected to learn fast and act.

fields.Slack Instruction & Email Commu:

Customer Discovery Challenge (Today 4:00–5:45pm)
Hey Pioneers!
After this masterclass, we have our first small challenge on customer discovery.
More challenges will follow as we try to incorporate your feedback to understand how others work.
You’ll be working in teams of 3 for a rapid-fire customer discovery exercise.
:dart: Your goal:
Get on as many calls as possible. Talk to real people and uncover real problems. Do not pitch ideas or solutions—just listen and learn. Use the #ask-for-intros channel.
:brain: How?
Pick a problem space (we assigned one to you - but you can also change it if your team agrees to it)
Reach out to people, get them on the phone. Use the Mom Test approach to ask better questions and get useful insights.
:phone: The more you're on the phone, the better. Ideally call together as a group.
:memo: Submit a Google Doc by 5:45pm
What you have to submit:
What methodology used to get leads (bullet points only)
Total leads contacted (Name, position, contact)
Total calls booked or taken
Key learnings (if you manage to get on calls)
:speaking_head_in_silhouette: Wrap-Up at 5:45pm
We’ll meet again to share learnings and reflections from 5:45 to 6:15pm.

Pioneers Investment Committee 12.09.2025 - Preparation Materials

Hello Pioneers Investors and VPs,
 
We’re just three days away from the first-ever Pioneers Investment Committee.

This is the culmination of 3 months of our Pioneers founders matching, grinding, and building ferociously at Station F to launch a global tech company. This Friday is where the most promising founders pitch to our committee to unlock a €100K investment for 7% of their company, securing a spot in the next stage of the program, and we’re happy to share this moment with you.

Reminder of key details
📅 Date: Friday, September 12, 2025
🕓 Time: 16:00-18:00
📍 Location: Bodyboard Room, Share Zone, Station F (ground floor)
💻 Remote option: Google Meet Link
 
Agenda
16:00-16:20 - Pioneers warplan strategy & roadmap
16:20-18:00 - Startup pitches (5 min pitch + 10 min Q&A)
18:00 onwards - Drinks. We’ll bring a couple of drinks to close out IC and would love if you to stay for a bit and join us.

-> We’ve sent you Station F invites and you may contact Niklas upon arrival to be guided in the conference room: +33 6 25 36 78 65
Ideally plan to arrive a few minutes early and bring a laptop to submit evaluations in real time.

Evaluating our Startups
We want your live input: After each pitch, please fill out this short scorecard.
👉 Startup Evaluation Form

Here’s the Selection criteria by level of importance: 
Execution & Traction (Sales and product execution)
Quality of Team (team background, cohesion, & founder-product fit)
Market Potential
We’ve prepared an overview of the pitching startups with:
Each team’s progress since joining the program 
Latest deck
Founder profiles
My personal comments on each team
👉 Startup Overview Hub
 
Voting Process
Investment Committee
4 votes total (Hugo, Bruno, Salomon, and myself).
A startup needs at least 3 out of 4 votes to be eligible for investment.
LPs’ Consultative Vote: Please use the Scorecard above to share your opinion on the selection. Your vote is advisory but will be considered in deliberations.
 
This is the most important milestone for our founders in the program, and your perspective makes the difference. Come ready to challenge the teams and help us decide who should get investment and a spot in the next stage.
 
Thanks again for joining us and for your trust. Looking forward to seeing you on Friday.
 
Best regards,
